hook.text: While medieval Europe was in darkness, Baghdad's House of Wisdom was translating every book it could find.

buildup.text: The Abbasid caliphs funded scholars to translate Greek, Persian, and Indian texts into Arabic. Knowledge was power.

climax.text: The Golden Age proved that civilizations advance fastest when they absorb knowledge from every culture.

punchline.text: Europe's Renaissance started with Arabic translations of Greek books.

quiz.question: What role did Baghdad's House of Wisdom play?
